description: A classic text, "The Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs." Written with examples in LISP, but applicable to any language.

variants.description: A classic text, "The Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs." Written with examples in LISP, but applicable to any language.

Also known as CLRS - a letter for the last names of each author - this book contains deep explanations for a range of algorithms divided across several self-contained chapters, with pseudocode presentation.

description: A college textbook on computer science.

variants.description: A college textbook on computer science.

name.str_pl: copies of Computer Science: An Overview

variants.description: The 13th edition, this book gives a bottom-up, concrete-to-abstract foundation in the subject, and encourages a practical and realistic understanding of computer science.

name.str: Everything You Need to Ace Computer Science and Coding in One Big Fat Notebook
name.str_pl: copies of Everything You Need to Ace Computer Science and Coding in One Big Fat Notebook

variants.description: Not as big as the back cover suggests, this book still contains lots of information for the reader about key concepts, definitions, diagrams, and doodles about computer science.

variants.description: A nice workbook that contains information about computer science beyond the common college program, with lots of practical examples and additional tools.

copies of How to Browse the Web

variants.description: Very beginner-level information about computers.

variants.description: A colorful book with lots of images detailing how to perform simple tasks in a computer system.

name.str_pl: copies of Hand Book On Computer Basics

variants.description: A small book that describes the very foundations of how computers and the internet work, with relevant examples.

name.str_pl: copies of Computers For Seniors For Dummies

variants.description: A simple guide to computers that'll show you what all the fuss is about.

name.str: Check Your English Vocabulary for Computers and Information Technology
name.str_pl: copies of Check Your English Vocabulary for Computers and Information Technology

variants.description: This workbook is designed to help non-native English speakers improve their knowledge and understanding of core computing and IT terminology, with definitions and some examples.

description: An informative magazine all about computers, both hardware and software.

variants.description: An informative magazine all about computers, both hardware and software.
An old, shabby magazine about hardware and software.  The last page says this is the last printed issue, as they are going all digital.
A shiny scientific journal that reviews fresh literature in the computer science field.
Journal that cover lot of aspects of software engineering, processes, and practices.
A practitioner-oriented magazine issued to all members of the society, containing articles and columns about different computing-related issues.
An entry-level textbook about computers.

name.str_pl: copies of An Introduction to Computer Science

variants.description: An introduction into computer world, based on simple computer language.  It guides the reader toward deep computer world.
Printouts, held together by a staple, that explain work in different applications, multimedia, the web, and basic work with hardware.

name.str_pl: copies of Teaching Computing in Secondary Schools

variants.description: A practical book for teachers about how to plan lessons and what they need to teach scholars about computer science.

name.str_pl: copies of The Elements of Computing Systems

variants.description: A book that describes how computers works, how they break big tasks into smaller and simpler tasks, and teaches how you can do the same.

description: A heavy textbook dedicated to advanced-level software design, written for several different programming languages.

This book illuminates durable principles at the heart of effective software development, with historic examples and personal experience.

variants.description: This book examines different architecture patterns and components of good application.

name.str: Advanced Game Design: A Systems Approach

variants.description: Author research how computer game works, how they build, and how to make proper gameplay parts and prototypes, with examples of real code.
This book describes the key features of popular computer languages with features you can use to enhance your working environment and experience, as well as your code.
This book shows the most common pitfalls inexperienced programmers may meet in their work, and different solutions one can use to resolve or avoid them.

name.str_pl: copies of Data-Driven Science and Engineering

variants.description: A guide for scientists and engineers describing how to use modern computer systems and methods in their work.

//: An entry-level book for younger coders that includes real coding practice.

A comics-like manual explaining how to perform simple code tasks, targeted at kids.

name.str: Computer Programming: Fundamentals for Absolute Beginners
name.str_pl: copies of Computer Programming: Fundamentals for Absolute Beginners

variants.description: A book that tries to teach the reader the most common programming activities - planning the work, making comfortable workarounds, designing the code schemes, and writing them in the right way.
This handbook describes the very basics of coding - creating and using variables, loops, decisions, objects - and examples of how and where to use them.

name.str_pl: copies of Computer Programming for Beginners: Fundamentals

variants.description: A small book that explains different skills a programmer needs to be able to code, in simple terms and with samples.
A beginner's guide to coding, with step-by-step instructions how to get started and write a simple program.

//: A pristine, almost untouched book about coding targeted at teenagers.
description: A thinly veiled attempt at teaching kids coding skills.  Not nearly as exciting as the authors might have hoped, but there's some real knowledge in here.

variants.description: A thinly veiled attempt at teaching kids coding skills.  Not nearly as exciting as the authors might have hoped, but there's some real knowledge in here.

name.str: First Steps in Coding: What's Decomposition?
name.str_pl: copies of First Steps in Coding: What's Decomposition?

variants.description: A tiny book with childish images of a robot, that explains what functional decomposition is, and how to use it properly.
A shiny book with lot of useful information about using code for different tasks inside the computer.  Sadly some big chunks of information are hidden behind QR code links, which you can't open.
A fully illustrated, friendly guide describing how different algorithms are used to solve practical problems - both in real life and in programming.
A tiny book that describe how games are created, alongside simple projects to make your own simple games, with lot of illustrations and funny facts.
